meanings.definition: To transport goods in bulk by truck, train, ship, or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The company was freighting the products to different cities.
meanings.sent2: The trucks were freighting the supplies to the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The idea of freighting the goods by hot air balloon seemed amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her words freighting through the room like a speeding train.
meanings.sent5: The image of freighting goods on a rocket ship made the concept unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The thought of failing the test was freighting for the students.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds freighting the beachgoers with the possibility of rain.
meanings.sent3: His freighting expression when seeing a spider was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was freighting, like a looming storm.
meanings.sent5: The news of the approaching hurricane was freighting for the coastal residents.

meanings.definition: The transportation of goods in bulk.
meanings.sent1: The freighting of goods by sea was a common practice in ancient times.
meanings.sent2: The company specialized in the freighting of heavy machinery.
meanings.sent3: The comical mishap during the freighting of the cargo brought laughter to the workers.
meanings.sent4: The freighting of memories from the past can sometimes be emotional.
meanings.sent5: The freighting of essential supplies to remote areas was crucial for their survival.
